intro: Goniolimon tataricum f. bulgaricum, commonly known as the Bulgarian tatarian goniolimon, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to grow in arid and rocky environments, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. It produces small, pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
